edu.cnm.deepdive.celestialbodies.model.entity

Class Star

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cnm.deepdive.celestialbodies.model.entity.Star

  • @Entity
public class Star
extends Object
    Defines a database entity and REST resource representing the attributes of a star.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Star() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double getAbsmag()
      Returns the star's absolute visual magnitude (its apparent magnitude from a distance of 10 parsecs).
      String getBase()
      Returns a star in a multiple star system.
      String getBayer()
      Returns the Bayer designation as a distinct value.
      String getBf()
      Returns The Bayer / Flamsteed designation, primarily from the Fifth Edition of the Yale Bright Star Catalog.
      Double getCi()
      Returns the star's color index (blue magnitude - visual magnitude), where known.
      double getComp_primary()
      Returns a star in a multiple star system.
      double getComp()
      Returns a star in a multiple star system.
      String getCon()
      Returns the standard constellation abbreviation
      double getDec()
      Returns the star's declination, for epoch and equinox 2000.0.
      double getDecrad()
      Returns the position in radians.
      double getDist()
      Returns the star's distance in parsecs
      String getFlam()
      Returns the Flamsteed number as a distinct value.
      String getGl()
      Returns the star's ID in the third edition of the Gliese Catalog of Nearby Stars.
      long getHd()
      Returns the star's ID in the Henry Draper catalog, if known.
      long getHip()
      Returns The star's ID in the Hipparcos catalog, if known.
      String getHr()
      Returns the star's ID in the Harvard Revised catalog, which is the same as its number in the Yale Bright Star Catalog.
      long getId()
      Returns the database primary key
      double getLum()
      Returns a star's luminosity as a multiple of Solar luminosity.
      double getMag()
      Returns the star's apparent visual magnitude.
      double getPmdec()
      Returns the star's proper motion in declination.
      double getPmdecrad()
      Returns the position in proper radians.
      double getPmra()
      Returns the star's proper motion in right ascension
      double getPmrarad()
      Returns the position in proper radians.
      String getProper()
      Returns a common name for the star.
      double getRa()
      Returns the star's right ascension for epoch and equinox 2000.0.
      double getRarad()
      Returns the position in radians
      Double getRv()
      Returns the star's radial velocity in km/sec, where known.
      String getSpect()
      Returns the star's spectral type, if known.
      Double getVar_max()
      Returns a star's approximate maximum magnitude.
      Double getVar_min()
      Returns a star's approximate minimum magnitude.
      String getVar()
      Returns a star's standard variable star designation, when known.
      Double getVx()
      Returns the Cartesian velocity components of the star, in the same coordinate system described immediately above.
      Double getVy()
      Returns the Cartesian velocity components of the star, in the same coordinate system described immediately above.
      Double getVz()
      Returns the Cartesian velocity components of the star, in the same coordinate system described immediately above.
      double getX()
      Returns the Cartesian coordinates of the star, in a system based on the equatorial coordinates as seen from Earth.

      Returns the Cartesian coordinates of the star, in a system based on the equatorial coordinates as seen from Earth.

      Returns the Cartesian coordinates of the star, in a system based on the equatorial coordinates as seen from Earth.

      • getBf

        public String getBf()
        Returns The Bayer / Flamsteed designation, primarily from the Fifth Edition of the Yale Bright Star Catalog. This is a combination of the two designations. The Flamsteed number, if present, is given first; then a three-letter abbreviation for the Bayer Greek letter; the Bayer superscript number, if present; and finally, the three-letter constellation abbreviation.
        Returns:
        bf the Bayer / Flamsteed designation.

      • setBf

        public void setBf(String bf)
        Sets the Bayer / Flamsteed designation.
        Parameters:
        bf - the Bayer / Flamsteed designation.

      • getX

        public double getX()
        Returns the Cartesian coordinates of the star, in a system based on the equatorial coordinates as seen from Earth. +X is in the direction of the vernal equinox (at epoch 2000)

      • setX

        public void setX(double x)
        Sets the Cartesian coordinates of the star, in a system based on the equatorial coordinates as seen from Earth. +X is in the direction of the vernal equinox (at epoch 2000)

      • getY

        public double getY()
        Returns the Cartesian coordinates of the star, in a system based on the equatorial coordinates as seen from Earth. +Y in the direction of R.A. 6 hours, declination 0 degrees.

      • setY

        public void setY(double y)
        Sets the Cartesian coordinates of the star, in a system based on the equatorial coordinates as seen from Earth. +Y in the direction of R.A. 6 hours, declination 0 degrees.

      • getZ

        public double getZ()
        Returns the Cartesian coordinates of the star, in a system based on the equatorial coordinates as seen from Earth. +Z towards the north celestial pole.

      • setZ

        public void setZ(double z)
        Sets the Cartesian coordinates of the star, in a system based on the equatorial coordinates as seen from Earth. +Z towards the north celestial pole.
